ray.rage.asset.skeleton

Class Skeleton

  • java.lang.Object
    • ray.rage.asset.AbstractAsset
      • ray.rage.asset.skeleton.Skeleton
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Asset, Disposable, Managed<AssetManager<? extends Asset>>, Nameable

    public final class Skeleton
extends AbstractAsset
    A Skeleton describes the hierarchy and structure of any number of bones. These bones are to be used to modify the vertices of submesh for skeletal animation. Within the submesh, each vertex has up to 3 bone parents and corresponding weights that determine the influence that up to 3 bones have on said vertex. This is kept track through the vertex having 3 bone indices that directly correlate to data stored in various buffers within the Skeleton class. A vertex can be influenced by no bones, or up to 3 bones.
    Author:
    Luis Gutierrez

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Gets the name used to identify this instance. In this case, the name of this asset.

        By default, the name of an asset is the name of the file it was actually loaded from, including the extension. In this case, the name of this skeleton.

        Specified by:
        getName in interface Asset
        Specified by:
        getName in interface Nameable
        Overrides:
        getName in class AbstractAsset
        Returns:
        The name.

      • notifyDispose

        public void notifyDispose()
        Description copied from interface: Disposable
        Explicitly releases the internal resources held by this instance, making it unusable afterwards.

        WARNING: This method is meant to be used internally by the framework and not by game clients. Use directly only if you really know what you're doing.

        Specified by:
        notifyDispose in interface Disposable
        Overrides:
        notifyDispose in class AbstractAsset
